ETYMOLOGY: Middle English, from a combination of 'all' (meaning 'wholly, entirely') and 'though'. It arose as an emphatic form of 'though'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Conjunction: a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In spite of the fact that; used to introduce a subordinate clause which expresses a contrast or concession to the main clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 尽管；虽然；用于引导表示让步或对比的从句。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Although she was tired, she stayed up late to finish the report.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 虽然她很累，但她还是熬夜完成了报告。

REGISTER: Standard English (used frequently in both speech and writing, slightly more formal than 'though')
